astfeeding practices is less clear than the biological and behavioural effects of breastfeeding on 
health. Best practices to increase EBF, and thus improve health, were reviewed in a Lancet series 
on maternal and child undernutrition (30). The review showed counselling is particularly effective 
in promoting EBF. As compared to control groups, EBF increased among mothers during the 
neonatal period (OR 3.45, 95% CI 2.20–5.42) and at 6 months of age (OR 1.39, CI 1.18–3.15)
